intro: Inula appendiculata, commonly known as the clustered-inula or yellow thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a distinctive lobed shape. Inula appendiculata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates.
